title: Jrue Holiday and Rob Williams return to Boston in stylish walk down memory lane

bullets: Boston Celtics A wistful welcome back to two beloved players of Celtics’ past, capping a nostalgic weekend of winning and winter weather.
The Celtics' Jordan Walsh is fouled by the Trail Blazers' Robert Williams III in the second quarter.

title: ‘The songs are the words I would say if I could’: Noah Kahan reveals release date for new album, ‘The Great Divide’

bullets: Music The album's first single, the title track, drops Friday.
Noah Kahan performs during a benefit concert for the Busyhead Project and Red Sox Foundation at MGM Music Hall in Boston on Nov.

title: Family of Uxbridge officer killed in line of duty gets surprise gift of Super Bowl tickets from Robert Kraft
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "These are happy tears," said Shannon LaPorta.
Robert Kraft prior to a Patriots-Jets game in December.
AP Photo/Frank Franklin Shannon and Matthew LaPorta thought they were at Gillette Stadium for a tour.

title: Prosecutors charging four children with murder in fatal Providence attack
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Medical examiners say the man died of blunt force trauma sustained in the group beating.
Previously: Prosecutors are charging four children between 11 and 12 years old with murder and conspiracy to commit felony assault in the Jan.
19 attack that eventually killed a 51-year-old man on Manton Avenue in Providence.

title: Smell you later: The strange power of scent in love and friendship
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Love Letters In this week's Love Letters, Meredith Goldstein shares how scent can shape attraction and friendship.
Emily Bader in Los Angeles, Jan.

title: Former NFL executive Bill Polian reportedly isn’t sure if he cast a HOF vote for Bill Belichick
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update After initially insisting that he voted for the former Patriots head coach, Polian later admitted he "could not remember with 100% certainty.
" Bill Polian speaking to reporters at the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2015.
AP Photo/Gene J.

title: This Maine police dept. turned its Facebook page into a meme account. The internet is loving it.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Off Beat “We’re goofy, but if somebody thinks because they’re goofy or because we’re goofy that they can get away with breaking the law, then they probably should reconsider that theory.
” Clinton, Maine, Patrolman Caleb Proctor and Cpl.
Mike Conners.

title: ‘Dumped’ dog in Needham found alive after 6 days and massive snowstorm
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Local News The black, wire-haired terrier mix survived below-freezing temperatures and nearly two feet of snow after being allegedly dumped in a parking lot.
This dog that was missing for six days and "bravely endured a massive snowstorm" has been found, Needham police said.
Needham Police Department A dog that went missing for six days and amid one of Massachusetts’ largest snowstorms in years was safely recovered Tuesday, Needham police said.

title: Where do the Swan Boats go in the winter?

bullets: Wickedpedia A look at the behind-the-scenes ritual that keeps the Swan Boats afloat — from fall dismantling to spring assembly.
The Swan Boats in the Boston Public Garden (David L.

title: After saving a man’s life, she’s running Boston to support the Red Cross
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston Marathon "When first responders arrived and he survived, I was overwhelmed with gratitude and humility.
" By Kelly Chan January 28, 2026 | 9:00 AM 1 minute to read In our “Why I’m Running” series, Boston Marathon athletes share what’s inspiring them to make the 26.
2-mile trek from Hopkinton to Boston.
